A feat represents a talent or an area of expertise that gives a character special capabilities beyond what their class provides.

At First Level: your @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-rules.JournalEntry.xu7KkQUPMqoEsg19]{Background} gives you the choice of any Level 1 Feat when you create a new 1st level character.

At Higher Levels: At Higher Levels: When you level up in your chosen class to levels 4, 8, 12, and 16, you gain a feat of your choice. You can choose a higher level feat if your total character level is equal to or higher than the level of the feat. You can take each feat only once, unless the feat's description says otherwise. You must meet any prerequisite specified in a feat to take that feat.

Feats From Other Sources: Click @UUID[.eeuvjJGRllcxw72L]{here} for information on how to use feats from outside Elkan 5e (1).

@UUID[.Zoi1ogaTYKuVKc7H]{(1)} Regarding Feats From Other Sources

Generally, our feats are weaker than the strongest feats from baseline 5e rules. This is because we adjusted the rules to allow characters to gain both a feat and an ability score improvement at levels 4, 8, 12, and 16. We encourage our players to only use the feats listed here, both because of game balance and also because some old feats no longer function as originally intended. If you want to use a 5e feat that wasn't designed for Elkan 5e, get your game master's approval first. We recommend that if you do pick an old feat, that it should replace both the feat and the ability score improvement for that level.

@UUID[.2t91Y7RxpO47fFbZ]{(2)} Regarding Qualifying for Combat Maneuver Feats:

In order to take a combat maneuver as a feat, you need to have a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class-features.Item.tSL6ilfth2TTRNTR]{Fighting Style}.

@UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class-features.Item.tSL6ilfth2TTRNTR]{Fighting Styles} are granted for free to every martial-oriented class. If you have at least 1 level of the @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.M8lNLAe2okA9qgFg]{Barbarian}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.a8ophKCiEGZarsnk]{Fighter}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.VQiQktedzIusKs4y]{Monk}, @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.Zg89AoSarbFbVnPY]{Paladin}, or @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.t9qEzMyJh0kg5Djk]{Ranger}, or @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class.Item.RTS23KqJMFWlzLKd]{Rogue} class, you have a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class-features.Item.tSL6ilfth2TTRNTR]{Fighting Style}. You might also choose the @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class-features.Item.tSL6ilfth2TTRNTR]{Fighting Style} feat, or gain the @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class-features.Item.tSL6ilfth2TTRNTR]{Fighting Style} feature somewhere else, such as with the Warlock's @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class-features.Item.QfgyRthZkHYTXO0I]{Pact of the Warrior}.

When you learn a combat maneuver feat, you learn how to execute a difficult move in melee or ranged combat.

Prerequisite: a @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class-features.Item.tSL6ilfth2TTRNTR]{Fighting Style}. Click @UUID[.eeuvjJGRllcxw72L]{here} if you're unsure if you qualify (2).

Level 8 combat maneuvers require that a character has the @UUID[Compendium.elkan5e.elkan5e-class-features.Item.mPbCg9EwNYa7Z7Lo]{Extra Attack} feature.
